"Painting my toenails," she replied. "I thought I'd try a different color. The teachers don't mind, since feet are usually covered." She showed off the variety of nail polish she had. "Want me to do yours?"
13221121121221211.title: Back in my room

132211211212212112.content:
"I guess there's no harm, since I'm stuck like this for the year," shrugging, I replied. "Something light, maybe."

Rachel smiled. "Would you prefer red or pink?"

After a thought, I replied, "Make the right foot pink and the left foot red." Blushing, I explained, "One foot into girlhood."

Rachel laughed. "I suits you," giggling, she said. "Alright, pay attention so you can do this yourself later."

I watched as Rachel carefully painted my nails. Surprisingly, I seemed to enjoy it. "Why two coats?" curious, I asked, seeing her applying a second layer.

"Actually, if you want the polish to last longer than a few days, you need three coats," she explained. "If you want, I can give you a few tips on makeup." Smiling again, she looked at me, adding, "There's no harm in learning, since you're stuck like this for the year."

I giggled at that, seeing the irony of my own words being used against me. "Alight," blushing slightly, I said. "Just don't make it so I draw attention from too many boys."

Rachel and I both laughed before the applied the third layer of polish to my toenails. Minutes later, Rachel had me in a chair in front of a shared vanity where she pulled my hair up, away from my face before holing it there with a hair clip. "Now, the first thing you need to know about makeup is that the idea is to look like you have none on at all." Going though a number of makeup products she said. "We start with a foundation that matches your skin color, so everything is one shade."

"Like preparing a canvas for painting," I guessed.

"Something like that," giggling, Rachel said.

She then proceeded to give me a makeover, explaining what each item was and how to apply it before turning me to face the mirror. "What do you think, Nico?" she asked. "Are you beautiful or what?"

A small gasp escaped my lips as I saw the beautiful girl staring back at me. "Wow... is that me?" blushing, I asked. "You did a great job."

Rachel smiled at my compliment. "Hey, I feel like taking a walk, want to join me?"

"Where are we walking to?" curious, I asked.

"There are two walking paths that run around the girls and boys dorm buildings respectively." putting her shoes on, Rachel replied. "So long as we are back in our dorms before sundown, no one really complains."

I nodded and, minutes later, we were walking along the path that circled the girls' dorms. We were chatting and giggled amongst ourselves when I let out a short scream. Someone had grabbed me from behind and placed a hand over my mouth to prevent any further screams from escaping. Rachel turned and let out a scream of her own as she saw a man in bluejeans, shirt, and jacket, holding me firm. I was terrified as I struggled to free myself from his grip. Only the man painfully turned my wrist, forcing me to fall silent. Rachel, seeing this, confronted the strange man. "Let her go!" angrily, she demanded.

"Please don't get the wrong idea." quickly, the man said. "I'm a private detective, investigating this school. I just want to ask you two a few questions."

"You are trespassing on school grounds and assaulting a student!" almost screaming, Rachel said. "Let my roommate go, and get out of here!"

"I'll go but, sorry, she comes with me." pulling me along, he said. "I'll release her once I get my answers."

That really made me panic, as I had no idea what this man's plans were. Then the man suddenly let out a yell of his own as someone lifted him off of me. Running back to Rachel, I turned to see the man in the grip of the towering Wardwell. The man turned pale, seeing how big the man was. He paled even more when Wardwell turned red with anger. "Not only have you trespassed and assaulted a student, you trampled all over my prize Ghost Orchids!" giving the man a slight shake, he thundered. "Do you have any idea how rare those flowers are!?!"

"I think that guy is in big trouble." whispering carefully, I said.

Wardwell then turned to us, his face softening. "Are you two injured?" ignoring the man for the moment, he asked.

"He- He twisted my wrist." showing him my now bruised wrist, I said.

Wardwell drew in an angry breath. "Both of you report to the infirmary," his breath heavy, he said. "You do not need to see what is about to come next."

Rachel and I gladly walked away, not daring to look back...
132211211212212112.title: Why not?

1322112112122121121.content:
By the time we got to the infirmary, my wrist was beginning to swell. "Oh, dear," said Dr. Willard. "What happened?"

"Some guy grabbed her," Rachel explained. "He said he was investigating the school."

Dr. Willard's face grew grim upon hearing that. "The magister and magistra must be informed of this. Where is this man now?"

"Wardwell has him," I answered.

"He said he trampled the Ghost Orchids," added Rachel.

Dr. Willard relaxed a little. "They'll hear of this soon enough, then. Let's see to you, Nico."

He made a few passes with his wand, which relieved my pain, then began wrapping my wrist. "You had a nasty sprain. It'll get better, but I suggest you take it easy on the wand-waving for the next few days. I'll write a note for you."

As I hopped down from the exam table, the magistra entered. "I just heard," she said. "Are you alright, Miss Child?"

"I'll be okay, ma'am. The doctor says I just need to go easy with my wand."

"Have you dealt with the man?" Dr. Willard asked.

"We will, shortly. I wanted to be sure our Miss Child wasn't too badly hurt. Needless to say, Wardwell has his own ideas about a suitable way to settle the matter."

"I don't doubt it. Blessed be, Magistra."

"Blessed be, Doctor. Bright blessings, girls."

"Blessed be, ma'am."
1322112112122121121.title: At the infirmary.

13221121121221211211.content:
Once Rachel and I were back in our dorm, I began to shake and cry. I fell onto my bed, covering my face with my hands. "I have never been so scared in my life!" I sobbed. "That man wanted to take me away to... who knows where!"

"Be at peace, Nico," sitting next to me, Rachel said. "You are safe, and that man is being dealt with."

"What- What do you think Wardwell will do to him?" still shaking, I asked.

Rachel sighed. "I'd rather not speculate," shaking her head, she said. "Some people who have given this school trouble faced a rather dark fate. This man threatened and harmed a student, which Wardwell takes great offense to." She then managed a weak smile, then added, "Next to his dogs and prized plants."

"I had always thought I could handle any situation. But I have never had to deal with the aspect of being kidnapped or... worse, now being a girl." Still trembling, I said, "So much for my science handling every problem."

"No study, no discipline can solve every problem, Nico," giving me a one armed hug, Rachel said. "Try to forget the negative events of this day and focus on the positive potential of tomorrow."

"I- I'll try," rubbing at my tears, I said. "It's just that guy scared the Nyuk out of me, I don't know if I can sleep right now."

"Well, I could do one of two things for you," pausing, Rachel said. "I can either make you a normal cup of tea to help calm your nerves, or cast a spell that will put you to sleep now."

Which am I to pick?
13221121121221211211.title: Back in my room

132211211212212112111.content:
"I think I'll stick with the tea," I decided. "I'm still not used to magick."

Rachel nodded. "Fair enough. I'll just start the hot plate, and get some water for the kettle."



After Rachel started brewing the tea, we heard a knock on the door. "Nico, it's Magistra Gardner. I have two police officers with me. May we come in?"

"Y-yes, Magistra," I said, opening the door.

As the magistra and the police entered, Rachel said, "It's just some chamomile tea, Magistra. I didn't think it was so serious."

Magistra Gardner smiled. "The tea is fine, girls. These officers would simply like to take Nico's statement regarding her attacker. I am on hand to observe, and see that she is not too upset."

I told the officers what had happened. When I finished, I asked, "Wh-what's going to happen to him?"

"You won't be seeing him again, Miss Child," one officer assured me. "Trespassing, destruction of private property, and assault and battery. That means he'll be going away for quite a while."

"It could have gone worse for him," said the other. "Right, Magistra?"

"Indeed," she replied. "It was only by reminding Wardwell that someone must have hired that detective that we were able to persuade him not to deal more permanently with him."

"Sorry to hear about the Ghost Orchids," said the first officer. "I hope not too many were damaged, so they can still be used in potions."

"We'll get by."

I was shocked. "Magistra,... why are you telling them this?"

"It's quite alright, Nico. These officers were once students here."

The second officer nodded. "These nightsticks conceal our wands."

I had never considered that a witch could be a police officer. Maybe I'd seen too many movies, but I hadn't thought of too many modern careers for witches.

As I sipped my tea, I thought of how Rachel had said that there was more than one way to approach things. Just because I was a witch didn't mean I couldn't continue my studies in science, just as the officers could be witches. Even being a girl wasn't a barrier, really.

Once I finished my tea, I set the cup on the desk and went to bed.
132211211212212112111.title: The tea.

choices: I am sent to see the counselor.
1322112112122121121111.content:
That night, I tossed and turned on my bed as if to try to escape the images running though my mind. I saw myself trying to outrun the reporter who had grabbed me earlier that night, only to be caught and dragged into a van. "You're pretty," smiling at me, the man said. "I think I'll have some fun during our interview."

I heard myself scream as he began to force my clothing off. I struggled, feeling the sheets of my bed becoming tangled around my limbs through my thrashing only I saw the man handcuffing me to the floor of the van by hooks used to hold shelves in place for his equipment. "I think we'll start with an oral interview then go... deeper," chuckling, the man said.

I screamed, feeling completely helpless as the man used a knife to cut away my clothing.

"Nico!" came a feminine voice from somewhere. "Nico, wake up!"

My eyes opened, filled with terror, as I screamed again. I was back in my dorm room with Rachel looking over me with a concerned look on her face. "You were having a nightmare, Nico," softly, she said. "I guess that private eye who grabbed you really shook you up."

I breathed an unsteady sigh of relief. "He- He was trying to... to..." I began to sob into my hands.

"Be at peace, Nico," sitting down next to me, Rachel said. "It was just a dream."

Then a heavy knock came to the door and two women entered with their wands drawn. "We heard screams," said the first woman, concerned. "Is all well here?"

"Nico had a nightmare about the detective who had grabbed her last night," quickly, Rachel explained. "All is well."

The two women nodded. "We, the seventh year hall monitors, will keep our eyes out, Nico." calmly, said the second woman. "Be at peace, we will issue a warning that no pranks are to be pulled on you today."

After they had left, I turned to Rachel. "They can keep pranks from being pulled on people?"

"The pranks are allowed to help students detect magical energy quickly," Rachel explained. "So long as they do not disrupt school functions, they are tolerated." She touched my shoulder. "You've been through a rough experience, any prank may cause you to automatically react with hostility, injuring other students."

"So the pranks aren't personal," surprised, I said. "They have a purpose."

"Everything done here has a purpose, Nico," smiling, Rachel said. "The pranks also help students develop a sense of humor to match their magick." Giggling, she added, "Like your science based pranks."

I smiled.
1322112112122121121111.title: Dreaming

13221121121221211211112.content:
As I reached the door to my next class with Rachel, we heard a feminine voice from inside say, "Blessed be, child. I am Professor Janet Good, please enter."

We were about to walk in when Rachel suddenly stopped me. "What?" curious, I asked.

"Note the faint glow around the door," Rachel said.

I focused my eyes and suddenly saw it. A dim glow around the open door. "Nice try, Professor Good," with a smile, I said. "You almost got me."

"We have had a rough night, Professor," firmly, Rachel said. "Please cancel the spell and allow us to come in; we have a no-prank pass."

The glowing around the door vanished and we cautiously entered to see Professor Good standing behind her desk with a bemused smile on her face. Professor Good was very tall and slender, with long flowing sandy blond hair, and ocean blue eyes that seemed to dance in the light. Her long dress accented her figure well, as she walked out from behind her desk and smiled at me.

"Forgive me, Miss Child; Miss Downs," looking at us, she said. "The glowing door was only to see if you have learned to detect magick, no prank was intended." She then giggled. "However, I do not teach spells or enchantments in this class."

My eyes widened as I noticed Rachel was now wearing the boys' school uniform. I turned to myself, hopeful, but sighed; I was still a girl. A scream escaped Rachel's lips as she, or rather, he discovered that his clothing was not the only thing that had changed. "Professor Good!" stomping one foot, he protested. "Have you not heard of last night's events!?"

The professor sighed, then placed a light hand onto our shoulder. "Do not fear, Master Downs," gently, she said. "You will return to your proper gender and attire upon leaving this classroom." She then pointed to a strange object above the door that looked like the male and female signs intertwined in a Celtic cross. "When you are able to forge a talisman that will counteract my gender swap charm, you will have passed a third of my class."

"A charm and an amulet are the other thirds of your class?" guessing, I asked.

"Correct. You will be affected until you learn to make each of the three objects I teach. Hands-on is the fastest way to learn this, and I find that using them against my students gives a good incentive for them to learn."

I giggled. "Careful, the students are permitted to prank the teachers back."

Professor Good shook her head, and pointed to a strange object that looked like a small shield with crossed wands over her desk. "Those who try to prank me or anyone else in this class will only have it turn back onto themselves as I keep a shield amulet over my desk." amused, she explained. "Yet another incentive to learn, if they even want a chance to prank me or anyone in my class."

"I think I'm going to like this class," smiling, Rachel said. "Um... where do I sit?"

"You may sit wherever you like, but I suggest you sit near the front of the class," pointing to two empty seats near a familiar looking girl, the professor replied. "I have a feeling your reputation of scientific pranks and Miss Procter here being the 'daughter' of the 'queen of pranks', will deter anyone from trying any pranks during class."

The girl looked at Professor Good, surprised, then gave me a curious look, causing the teacher to giggle. "You are not the only one with a reputation, Miss Procter," smiling, she said. "Miss Child is known to be quite skilled in science, and 'he' went toe to toe with a seventh year student."

"That's why I'm a girl now," pouting slightly, I said.

"True, but your opponent talks like a girl," the professor said. "That is why other seventh years are impressed by you, Miss Child; you show promise of becoming a great witch."

This made me feel a little better, as I unconsciously twirled a strand of hair with my finger. I did not know why, but it seemed to make me look cute, as Rachel chuckled. Professor Good giggled, then turned as another student approached the door. The three of us shared a quick grin before she said, "Blessed be, child. I am Professor Janet Good, please enter..."
13221121121221211211112.title: Back to class.

choices: I am offered a unique challenge.
132211211212212112111121.content:
Once all of the students had been given the gender swap scare and introduction, Professor Good sat at her desk and called for silence in the room. "There are twelve steps in creating a talisman," she began. "We will go over each step in length throughout the school year."

"Are there also twelve steps to creating charms and an amulets?" curious, I asked.

"We will get to those objects soon enough, Miss Child," she replied. "Please open the book in front of you to page five. If anyone looks at the pages before, their new gender will be locked until sundown."

"Why threaten us, professor?" annoyed, a boy asked. "I don't understand."

"The first four pages of the book are a quick reference guide, Mister Alexander," simply, the professor explained. "I was not allowed to remove them from the book, as students are permitted to purchase them after graduation." She then frowned. "There will be no shortcuts in my class! They will not help you when you need to make a magickal charm, talisman, or amulet in a pinch!"

Everyone turned to page five, careful not to look at the first four pages. On page five was the following...

The twelve steps to creating a talisman.

1. Decide the purpose of the talisman.
Without first assigning a purpose, your talisman will be nothing more than a fancy piece of jewelry.

2. Identify appropriate planetary influences to determine best time for ritual.
Without this important phase, your talisman will not have enough power for the task you had selected. If this is done improperly, your talisman may not have enough power, or worse, too much. Know your planets and their influences before going any further.

3. Undertake self-purification.
Without this cleansing ritual, anything you make with the use of magick will not be pure in turn, causing unpredictable results.

4. Don ritual garments, and gather appropriate magical tools.
This should be self-explanatory but always use the right garments and tools for any job. If you do not know them, do not continue until you do.

5. Create a magick circle to work within.
This is a very important step as it focuses all the magick being used into one focused area, making the other steps easier to control.

6. Invoke appropriate divine, angelic, and spirit help.
Everyone, even the most experienced witch, needs guidance. Allow the spirits to guide your hand and your words so your talisman will reach its full potential and mistakes you may have made in the previous steps may be spotted and corrected before it is too late.

7. Inscribe a circle on a piece of metal, parchment, or paper.
Doing this on paper or paper and parchment would be for a specific short-term objective, so the talisman may be destroyed when the goal is achieved. Doing this on metal (depending on the metal type) is for longer purposes.

8. Inscribe symbols and sigils.
These symbols must be associated with the appropriate planet, as well as any sacred names, words, or charms, on one or both sides of the talisman in order to grant it the power desired.

9. Focus intent, will, and emotional energy during inscription.
This locks in the purpose of the talisman so it will do the task desired once activated or triggered.

10. Purify talisman
This is done by passing metal through fire (such as a candle flame) or paper through smoke of incense.

11. Charge talisman with magical power.
This must be done by consecrating it in a ritual on the appropriate day of the planet.

12. Store or wear talisman in protective covering.
This is for the protection of the talisman and the protection of those the talisman is not intended for. Unless the talisman is given the purpose for a specific person or group, it will effect anyone who wears it or walks under it.

"Your lesson for the first day is to study those steps," kindly, the professor said. "You have already been given the talisman's purpose, to counteract the gender swap talisman I have introduced you all to." She then giggled. "I will gladly lock the talisman's effects onto those who wish to earn extra credit and walk in the shoes of the opposite gender."

Who takes the challenge?
132211211212212112111121.title: class begins.

1322112112122121121111211.content:
"I'll do it, Professor." raising her hand, 'Miss' Proctor said.

"So will I," said a boy I couldn't see.

"Splendid," pleased, Professor Good replied. "The Procter children are on board. Who else would like to join them?"

One by one, other students volunteered for the extra credit assignment. When the teacher had five boys and five girls, she said, "Very good. Would our volunteers please rise?"

After the students had stood, she pointed her wand at each of them and cast her spell. "I'll leave the rest of our class time open, so that our extra-credit students may choose who to exchange rooms with." smiling, she said.

Knowing I was denied the opportunity for the extra credit assignment, I decided to ask why. I rose my hand and Professor Good acknowledged me. "Professor, my sex wasn't changed when I came in. Why is that?"

"You are already under an enchantment, Miss Child," the professor explained. "However, you should still work on your talisman along with your fellow students. After all, you won't be under that enchantment forever. Come up to my desk, and I will give you an alternate extra credit assignment."

I walked up to the professor's desk and she pointed to two envelopes. "I offer this extra credit assignment choice to those who are either not keen on changing genders but still want extra credit or who are unaffected by the talisman due to an enchantment or spell cast upon them," quietly, she explained. "The first is a prank assignment with a non-retaliation pass. You will enter the boys dormitory and hand a letter to Professor Vine; he teaches magickal creatures class and he is my older brother."

"What is the letter for?" curious, I asked. "How is it a prank?"

"That is between Professor Vine and myself," firmly but kindly, Professor Good replied. "All you need to concern yourself with, if you accept, is to sneak into the boys dorm and personally hand it to him in his dorm chambers."

"What is the second option?" not keen on the first choice, you asked.

"The second option is to write a report on the reason pranks are permitted in school," smiling, Professor Good replied. "You may ask any seventh year student you like, they will answer. However, not many know the history behind the pranks."

"Other professors might," after a thought, I said.

"If you can get them to share that knowledge," smiling, Professor Good replied.

I smiled back but suddenly froze as I felt a twinge of pain in my neither regions. Something was not right, I felt a dampness there and looked down to see... blood. My eyes widened; I wanted to scream. Professor Good saw this and immediately grabbed her wand and waved it at me. The bleeding seemed to stop but the professor still looked concerned.

"Class is dismissed!" quickly, she said. "Everyone report to your dorms immediately! I have a medical situation I need to deal with!"

Rachel ran over, looking concerned. "What happened!?"

"Miss Child is experiencing her first period early, Rachel," quietly, Professor Good replied. "Please come with us to the infirmary."

Rachel quickly nodded and followed the professor out, holding my other hand. "Everything is going to be okay, Nico," seeing me crying, she said. "Don't be afraid."
1322112112122121121111211.title: A few take the challenge.

13221121121221211211112111.content:
"Remain calm, Miss Child," Professor Good said, as we took the elevator down to the infirmary.

"How can I be calm?" I demanded. "What's happening to me?"

"It'll be okay, Nico," Rachel assured me, squeezing my hand. "I promise."

We entered the infirmary, and Dr. Willard looked up to greet us. "Good afternoon, Professor Good," he said. "What seems to be the problem?"

"Miss Child has just gotten her first period," the professor explained.

The doctor led me to an examination table. "Highly unusual, given your class."

"She's under a spell by a seventh-year student, Dr. Willard."

He took a more careful look at my face. "Ah yes, I remember now. You're the one who used to be a boy, aren't you?"

I nodded. "I hope to be one again, as soon as possible. Doctor, why is this happening to me?"

"I would venture to guess, Miss Child," he replied, "that your recent shock has greatly upset your system, triggering your menses at an earlier age than average."

"Can you make it stop?"

He shook his head. "I'm sorry, but I cannot interfere with the way a healthy body operates."

I sighed. "At least maybe I'll get changed back before this happens again."

"I'm sorry again, Miss Child, but this has greater implications. Your cycle may interfere with that spell."

I sat up. "What are you saying, doc?"

He sighed. "It is possible that getting your period so soon may mean that you will not turn back into a boy."

I passed out.
13221121121221211211112111.title: At the infirmary.

132211211212212112111121111.content:
I woke up a few minutes later to find Rachel and Professor Good still in the room, with Dr. Willard and the counselor, Mrs. Procter. "Miss Child, I called for Counselor Procter the moment you fainted," gently, Professor Good explained. "She will help you through this."

"There is something you need to know before I release you to your dorm, Miss Child." seriously, Dr. Willard said. "There is still a slight chance you will become a boy again, once the spell expires, but that chance is slim. Again, I am sorry."

"It's not your fault," managing a weak smile, I said. "Just bad luck."

"Miss Child, they will be holding an all girls sleepover soon," looking at me, Mrs. Procter said. "I suggest you consider attending, it may help you reduce some of your stress."

"A sleepover?" uncertain, I asked.

"There will be no pranks, as it is an official school function, designed to allow all the girls to get to know each other," touching my shoulder, Mrs. Procter replied. "It will allow you to freely mingle in a relaxed atmosphere. Also, if you feel the need to talk about what happened last night, please do not hesitate to come to my office."

I teared up again. "It- It's just that I can't seem to get over how helpless I felt," crying, I said. "Knowing he wanted to drag me off to who knows where and... and... "

Mrs. Procter took my shaking hand into hers and brushed my hair with her other in a soothing way. "There, there, Miss Child," softly, she said. "You need not concern yourself; that man will never harm you again, and extra security has been arranged."

"I will make sure Nico has everything she needs to ride through her first period." serious, Rachel said. "She can borrow some of my pads, I'm over mine for now."

Mrs. Procter nodded. "That's fine, dear," smiling she said. She then turned back to me. "The sleepover will be good for you, Miss Child. I will be there as well. Please think about it."

I nodded. "It sounds like fun," trying to compose myself, I said. "Professor Good,... "

"Yes, child?" stepping closer, Professor Good asked.

"I-I'll take the prank report for my extra credit."

Professor Good giggled. "That's fine."
132211211212212112111121111.title: Awakening in the infirmary

1322112112122121121111211111.content:
"I can't believe how uncomfortable this is," I said as I shifted my position for the umpteenth time. I was having real difficulty getting used to wearing a pad.

"Try to look on the bright side," Rachel said. "It'll be over in a few days."

"And then it'll start again in another month," I replied. "And what's this tube of cream the doc gave me?"

Rachel opened her mouth to speak, paused as if to reconsider her words, then said, "You're having your first period."

"I am well aware of that fact, and its implications."

"Not all its implications." She paused again. "See, normally, when a girl gets her first period, her breasts have been developing for a couple of years."

"But I'm still flat as a board."

Rachel nodded. "The doctor thinks there's a chance that your 'girls' will start playing catch-up."

I put a hand to my chest. "You... you mean... ?"

"I'm afraid so. If it starts, your chest will start itching like crazy, like you've got a rash. The cream is to soothe the itch."

I fell back on my bed. "And what about the rest of it? If that's what's gonna happen, I'm gonna need bras."

"We'll find something for you until things stabilize. Don't worry. You've got me and the faculty looking out for you."

Easy for them to say. None of them knew what it was like to be a boy for eleven years, then be told they'd grow breasts.
1322112112122121121111211111.title: back to my dorm room.

13221121121221211211112111111.content:
I got up early the next morning, still shaken by the events of the past few days, and got dressed, with the intention of taking a walk before breakfast. I left a note for Rachel, so she would not worry, and left my dorm room to wander the halls.

"My whole world is turning upside down." sniffling, I muttered. "What's worse is, for the first time, I have no idea what I'm going to do about it."

I felt an itch and instinctively reached up to scratch but, seeing where the itch was, I panicked and ran into the girls' restroom. Fortunately, it was empty, and I lifted my blouse in front of the mirror. Just as my roommate had described, my nipples were red and swollen, as if I had some form of rash. Also, as Rachel had warned, they itched like mad. "It- It's happening already!?" tearfully, I asked myself. "What more can happen to me!?"

This proved to be more than I could take and I slumped down onto my knees, crying uncontrollably but softly into my blouse. I do not know how long I was crying, but I paused as a soft hand touched my shoulder. "Hey, there," a feminine voice said. "What's wrong? Did someone prank you?"

I looked up, misery clear on my face, and saw a tall and slender teenage girl wearing the prefect badge on her school uniform. "My- My name is Ni- Nico Child." between tears, I said.

"The transformed boy who was attacked by the reporter," nodding, the girl said. "I see. I am Melissa Strange, prefect captain for the seventh year class." Pausing, she asked, "Please explain what happened here, Miss Child?"

"I- I had my first per-period," trembling, I replied. "The doctor told me that... that I may start growing breasts soon because of it."

A low gasp escaped Melissa's lips. "Is this starting now?" softly, she asked.

Whimpering, I slowly nodded and lifted my blouse so she could see. Melissa pushed my hands back down, giving me a sympathetic look. "This is a part of growing up for a girl," gently, she explained. "However, just because you are going through these changes early, it does not mean you are stuck this way for life."

"What- What do you mean?" shaken, I asked.

"It is Cohan's curse that is keeping you a girl," firmly but kindly, Melissa said. "Right now, you body is reacting just like any other girl's body would. A heavy shock or trauma can cause a little girl to start having periods early, meaning developing early as well."

"So I can be a boy again?" uncertain, I asked.

Melissa sighed. "Unfortunately, trauma can also lock a curse into place," wincing, she said. "There is no way to know for certain until the curse has run its course." Seeing me cry again, she quickly added, "By the way, nice touch with the feminine voice on Cohan. He's getting his fair share of teasing over that, believe me."

That caused me to smile slightly.
13221121121221211211112111111.title: Start talking to older students

132211211212212112111121111112.content:
I walked with Rachel into Chalice Hall, where we met up with an upperclasswoman who seemed to have been waiting for us to arrive. She smiled, making me jump. Seeing this, she sighed. "You two have nothing to fear from pranks tonight," serious, she said. "This sleepover is a school function, to allow all the students, young and old, to get to know each other."

"This is Nico Child, the transformed boy who was attacked by that reporter." appearing behind us, Melissa Strange said. "She has been jumpy ever since."

The girl gave me a sympathetic look. "I'm sorry you went through that." softly, she said. "Please, try to enjoy the festivities. I am Melissa Stonehenge; welcome to the all girls sleep over."

With that, she stepped aside, allowing us to walk in. I saw several girls there, all talking amongst themselves around various tables where a wide variety of snacks were being offered. I walked over to the most isolated table I could find and picked up a small plate to sample some of the snacks that were offered there as Rachel and Melissa Strange followed. "I wonder if there is more to her being jumpy than that incident." quietly, Melissa said.

Rachel sighed. "Nico told me that she felt confident she could handle any situation." whispering, she replied. "She felt helpless against that reporter and now she feels helpless against her own body as it is developing earlier than normal."

Melissa winced. "That's rough."

Having heard their conversation, I decided it best not to respond and try my best to relax. It was hard under the circumstances. Before, I felt as if I could conquer the world and now I feel like a tiny grain of sand on a massive beach. I felt the urge to cry again but a voice snapped me out of my thoughts.

"I'm glad to see I'm not the only transformed boy to attend this sleepover." causally, she said.

I spun around, startled, and sighed as I found myself facing Sam Procter from Professor Good's class. "Sorry, you startled me," catching my breath, I said. "Recent events have me a bit jumpy."

"I had my share." smiling, Sam said. "How are you taking to the experience?"

"Being a girl I can get used to," frowning slightly, I said. "It's some of the things girls do, and now I'm finding myself doing, that have me stumped."

"Like what?" curious, Sam asked.

"Switching from one emotion extreme to another, for one," sighing, I replied. "Sometimes, I don't know what I am feeling, and it makes it harder to talk about it to anyone who has not experienced it." I let out a low sigh. "I never thought it could start as early as eleven..."

"One of a million mysteries," giggling, Sam said. Only she stopped giggling when another girl whispered in her ear, causing Sam to blush brightly, as she turned back to me. "I- I'm so sorry," stammering, she said. "I didn't know."

"It's no big, just a period," sniffing, I said. "Dr. Willard told me that the scare I had earlier could have triggered it to start early, but it also means...." I tearfully sighed.

"Your chances of changing back have diminished?" the other girl guessed.

I held back a sob as I nodded. "Dr. Willard explained that there is a standing rule spell here, that places a child into a magickal 'lock down' if her menstrual cycle starts early, as their emotions will run dangerously high," tears falling, I said. "The spell that changed me is locked and may not be reversible."

"When will you know for certain?" concerned, Sam asked.

"At the end of the year, when the curse is due to cancel itself," frowning, I replied. "Ironically, I find myself uncertain if I want to change back."

Hearing that, Sam smiled. "You have a full year to worry about this," taking my arm, she said. "Come on, there will be no pranks here tonight, so let's get to know everyone."

"Go on, Nico," stepping up, Tonya said. "It'll be good for you to mingle a little."

I sighed, then followed Sam into the crowd, where we talked to a group of...
132211211212212112111121111112.title: The sleepover.

1322112112122121121111211111121.content:
I put my guard up the moment I saw the seventh-years come in. Apparently, I wasn't the only one.

"Just a reminder," Melissa said, "there will be no pranks tonight. You are all safe here, as in your own beds."

"But why are some of the pranks so cruel?" I asked. "My roommate was stripped naked, in front of everybody."

"The pranks aren't supposed to escalate into cruelty," replied an upperclasswoman. "They're supposed to get you on your toes, in case you're attacked by a witch with bad intentions. Unfortunately, there's no way to weed out the malicious ones."

"Try to remember," said another, "that we were all first-year students, ourselves. We were pranked, just like you. And Mrs. Procter was still in college in our first year, so we didn't have her keeping an eye out for us."

"And those of you with older siblings," added a third, "know that pranks don't stop at the gate. Some of us got pranked in our own homes, by older brothers and sisters looking to get a rise out of us."

The first girl pointed at Sam. "Excuse me, but I don't think I've seen you before. How did you get in here?"

"I'm Sam Procter," she replied. "I took Professor Good's extra-credit assignment."

The older girl was put at ease, and laughed in recognition. "I hope you've got a good partner, Sam. I spent the entire semester with a thing."

These stories sounded plausible. It sounded like the seventh-years were like us, just older and more experienced. Most of the pranks weren't supposed to be mean-spirited, just embarrassing. With my history of science-based pranks, I could relate to that.

My mind was pulled away from these thoughts by abdominal cramps, and I clutched my stomach reflexively. "You okay, Nico?" asked one of the girls.

"First period," I explained. "I was attacked by a cowan, and they think that started me off early."

"You'll be okay, Nico," replied the second upperclasswoman from before. "Everybody here knows what you're going through, or knows someone who does. I'm sure even Sam, here, has heard some stories."

"Not really," Sam replied. "Nobody thinks to talk to boys about menstrual cycles. That may be part of what's got Nico so scared. Nothing she's been told before has prepared her for this."

I was touched. Sam had really given thought to my circumstances. I squeezed her hand. "Thanks."

She squeezed back, and kissed me on the cheek.

As I wiped my cheek, I did something I hadn't felt like doing very often since coming to Ravenscroft: I smiled.
1322112112122121121111211111121.title: seventh year students.

13221121121221211211112111111211.content:
As we spoke with the older girls, one of the teachers popped in. "Just a reminder, children," she said, "tomorrow, those of you who are doing well in your classes will be allowed to take one of our buses into town for a few hours. There, you will be free to shop, or see a movie. This is not strictly a school function, but you are encouraged to wear your uniforms, and to conduct yourselves as representatives of Ravenscroft Academy."

I raised my hand. "Will there be pranks?"

She smiled. "As I said, those who are allowed to go must present a positive face for the school. Also, students should refrain from using magick in town, lest we be exposed to cowan eyes."



When we were done talking to the older students, it was time for bed, so we unrolled our sleeping bags. Once I was almost ready, I ran to the restroom. Part of my preparation for bed, after all, involved a fresh pad and rubbing analgesic cream on my budding breasts, and I didn't want an audience for either.

When I was finished, I returned to my sleeping bag. Sam asked me, "Are you okay?"

"Early puberty is rough," I replied. "Sometimes, I'd really like to get my hands on the man who put me through this."

"From what I hear, if Wardwell got his way, he would do worse than you could think of."

"Worse than growing breasts and having periods? I can't think of it."

"Everything will be okay, Nico. Relax. We get to have some fun in town, remember."

I started crawling into my sleeping bag. "A movie would be nice."

Sam started crawling into hers, then gasped. "I just remembered. My friends live in town."

"So you'd get to hang out with them?"

"Avoid them, is more like it. I can't explain to them why I've got long hair, and am wearing a skirt."

"Guess it's my turn to tell you to relax. You'll be a face in the crowd. Maybe they won't even recognize you. They'd be looking for a boy, not a girl."

Once we both calmed down, we went to sleep.
13221121121221211211112111111211.title: Bedding down for the night

132211211212212112111121111112111.content:
It was winter. I got off the bus right outside my home. My parents were waiting for me. "Welcome back, Nico," Mom said, hugging me.

"How's school going?" Dad asked.

"Better all the time," I replied.

"Come on inside," Dad said. "Go on up to your room and get changed."

I quickly went upstairs to my room, and opened the door. I gasped at what I saw.

There, laying on the bed waiting for me, was a powder blue dress.

I didn't need any more encouragement. I took off my uniform and put on the dress. Once it was on, I checked out my reflection in the mirror. I loved the way I looked in that dress.

I stepped out of my room, and saw all my relatives waiting for me. They all congratulated me on getting into Ravenscroft, and said that I was beautiful in that dress.



I opened my eyes. I wasn't home. I was at the sleepover. It was a dream. I rolled over and settled down again.

Something about the dream troubled me, though. As I closed my eyes, I realized what it was: Part of me missed that beautiful powder blue dress.
132211211212212112111121111112111.title: Dreaming

1322112112122121121111211111121111.content:
The next day, Rachel and I gathered outside of Cauldron Hall with a number of other first year students to go into town for some shopping and perhaps a movie. My name is Samuel Stone, I never really knew my birth parents as I was adopted at the age of five after they had died in a traffic accident involving several cars. I was with a babysitter at the time. My adopted family and I lived just a few blocks away from the Ravenscroft boarding school where my friends and I loved to play in an open field on the edge of their property. Now, I had always been seen as an odd person as I had keen senses, sharp reflexes, and above average attributes but these same quirks earned me some good friends who stood by my side.

It was on my eleventh birthday when my life changed forever. I was in the field with my friends, playing baseball when John Scooter, one of my friends, hit the ball high, over the main gate of the school. "Oh crap!" he said, seeing where the high flying ball had landed. "That's an out and the game. we don't have another ball!"

"I'll get it." I said with a sigh.

"You're not seriously going to climb the fence!?" asked Tracey Wild, another friend.

"Of course not." I replied. "I'm going to buzz them at the main gate. I'm sure they won't mind giving us our ball back if I'm honest and polite about it."

With that said, I walked over to the main gate and hit the call button. A moment later, a voice answered. "Please state your name and your business." said a voice, through a speaker.

"I am Samuel Stone." I replied. "I'm afraid that we accidentally knocked our baseball onto your property, I am terribly sorry, could you send someone to retrieve it for me?"

Unknown to me, the woman on the other side of the camera, a secretary named Wilma Jennings, rose a single eyebrow. "One moment, please." she replied.

As I waited, Wilma turned to Daniel Cochrane, the magister, and showed him a six year old missing persons report with my picture on it. "It's him." she said, away from the microphone. "I'm sure of it."

Daniel rubbed his chin in thought. "Let him in." he said. "Have Wardwell bring him to my office, I'll notify Mrs. Procter."

A moment later, the gates opened with a buzz and Wilma's voice rang through. "Please follow Wardwell to the main building." she said, politely. "The magister would like to speak with you."

I shrugged, unaware of any trouble. "Okay." I said. "I should, at least say hi, or something."

With that, I followed the towering man onto the school grounds, with the gates closing behind me, while John and Tracey, unknown to me, had a strange urge to return home.

"This way, please." said Wardwell, calmly. "I'm surprised you are not fearful of my presence, most people are."

"It takes a lot to scare me, sir." I replied. "I watch horror movies."

Wardwell chuckled then stopped at a door. "This is the magister's office." he said. "He is waiting for you."

I nodded and thanked Wardwell then walked into the office where I met a tall, well dressed man behind a desk and tall, attractively dressed woman standing in front of it. Upon seeing the woman, I gasped. "Mom...."

The woman, Mrs. Procter, teared up. "Samuel..."

What happens next?

I recognized my mom as her soft face and kind voice were still fresh in my mind, even after six years. When mom knelt, opening her arms to me, I became overwhelmed with emotion. Tears fell like rivers as I ran into her embrace and exploded into infantile sobbing. Mom rocked me like a small child, crying herself.

"Oh, my baby!" she sobbed, holding me. "I never stopped searching for you!"

"Mom... I mean Miss Stone told me that you and dad died in a car accident." I said, between sobs. "What happened?"

Mom looked me in the eye. "We were in a car accident, six years ago, honey." she said. "Only we got out of it with only a few scratches and bruises." she sniffed, rubbing her tears. "When we returned home from the hospital, you and the sitter we hired were gone."

"She kidnapped me!?" I asked, stunned.

Mom nodded, a certain anger entering her voice. "Yes, she did." she replied. "Don't worry, though, she will never get her hands on you again."

I teared up again. "Is dad still alive?" I asked.

Mom nodded. "Yes, we will talk to him over the phone together later on." she promised. "Right now... I'm just happy to see you alive."

Mom and I shared another tearful embrace before Daniel politely cleared his throat, causing us to break the hug. "Forgive the interruption, Mrs Procter, but I believe your son is eligible for enrollment in this school." he said, glancing upwards.

I followed the magister's gaze and spotted a beautiful chandelier, glowing brightly above me. Mom looked at it then giggled before turning to me. "There is something you need to know about your real family, Samuel." she said. "Your father and I are witches and so are you."

"What?" I asked. confused.

Mom took a pen from her pocket and held it up for me to see then let it go. I looked down to see where it fell but did not see it until I looked back at mom. A short scream escaped my lips as I saw the pen floating in mid air. "Oh, wow." I said. "That's so cool, mom."

Mom smiled. "You have this power too, Samuel, here we can teach you how to control it." she said. "However, we must first deal with your kidnapper."

I turned slightly pale, guessing what magick could do to her. "Please don't hurt her." I begged. "I know what she did was very wrong, but..."

"The law will handle her." replied mom, serious. "If she comes here after you, however,..."

"It's 'game on'." I finished.

"I will get the paperwork moving on young Samuel's transfer and notify our friends in the police department." said Daniel. "Why don't you give your son a tour then call your husband."

Mom nodded then turned to me. "Are you ready to see your new school?" she asked.

I smiled, teary eyed again. "Lead the way... mom." I said.

Once you were born, that presented a new set of challenges. I couldn't find a sitter during school hours, so I had to carry you everywhere. On top of that, for some reason, you wouldn't take a bottle, so I had to drop whatever I was doing and 'serve' you at any moment. Once you started walking, I had to watch you constantly. I turned to look at her. "I used to dream about us riding a broom. I could never figure out how come."

She tousled my hair. "You were remembering one of our happiest times. I think the hardest part was persuading you to let go of the broomstick, once class was over."

"And you did that without any help?"

"Nothing is done without help, Sam. My dormmate, Skye, didn't mind helping after school. She didn't even mind changing your diapers. Perhaps she was used to it. She was a Christian witch, and her parents had a large family. I should call her sometime, see how she's doing.

"And, of course, there was Miles, your father. He had promised to help me in any way he could, and he kept his promise. After graduation, we invited a good number of our classmates to our handfasting."

"Handfasting? What's that?"

"It's a witch version of a wedding ceremony. Magistra Gardner officiated. All were dressed in white. Instead of exchanging rings, we had our hands bound together with a silken cord, to signify that we would be together as long as our love lasted. At the end, we jumped over a broomstick, to signify our journey into a new life. I'll show you the pictures, after we call your father."
